title: [K-12] Collaborative Digital Literacy Curriculum Design for Early Childhood Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of early childhood education and digital tools, with experience using online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Learners participate in redesigning a digital literacy education framework suitable for early childhood development stages based on scientific approaches.

learning_goals: Design three or more digital literacy education activities appropriate for early childhood developmental stages and establish evaluation criteria.
Collaboratively develop a curriculum prototype with peer learners using collaboration tools.

After participating in a 2-week digital literacy program (e.g., online information search, fake news identification), learners write a 3–5-page project report measuring educational effectiveness. The report must include data collection methods (surveys of ≥10 participants), analysis results (≥1 graph), and ≥3 improvement suggestions.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
